title: Google\Cloud\Firestore\FirestoreClient
name: FirestoreClient
description:
Cloud Firestore is a flexible, scalable, realtime database for mobile, web, and server development.

In production environments, it is highly recommended that you make use of the Protobuf PHP extension for improved performance. Protobuf can be installed via PECL.

$ pecl install protobuf

To enable the Google Cloud Firestore Emulator, set the FIRESTORE_EMULATOR_HOST to the value provided by the gcloud command.

Please note that Google Cloud PHP currently does not support IPv6 hostnames. If the Firestore emulator provides a IPv6 hostname, or a comma-separated list of both IPv6 and IPv4 names, be sure to set the environment variable to only an IPv4 address. The equivalent of [::1]:8080, for instance, would be 127.0.0.1:8080.

examples.caption: Using the Firestore Emulator

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Create a Firestore client. Please note that this client requires the gRPC extension.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: config.apiEndpoint
params.description: A hostname with optional port to use in place of the service's default endpoint.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache for storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

params.name: config.quotaProject
params.description: Specifies a user project to bill for access charges associated with the request.

params.name: config.returnInt64AsObject
params.description: If true, 64 bit integers will be returned as a Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 object for 32 bit platform compatibility. Defaults to false.

exceptions.description: If the gRPC extension is not enabled.

methods.name: batch
methods.description:
Get a Batch Writer

The Google\Cloud\Firestore\WriteBatch allows more performant multi-document, atomic updates.

methods.name: collection
methods.description:
Lazily instantiate a Collection reference.

Collections hold Firestore documents. Collections cannot be created or deleted directly - they exist only as implicit namespaces. Once no child documents remain in a collection, it ceases to exist.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the collection.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

methods.name: document
methods.description: Get a reference to a Firestore document.

params.name: name
params.description: The document name or a path, relative to the database.

exceptions.description: If the given path is not a valid document path.

methods.name: documents
methods.description:
Get a list of documents by their path.

The number of results generated will be equal to the number of documents requested, except in case of error.

Note that this method will always return instances of Google\Cloud\Firestore\DocumentSnapshot, even if the documents requested do not exist. It is highly recommended that you check for existence before accessing document data.

examples.caption: To check whether a given document exists, use DocumentSnapshot::exists().

params.name: paths
params.description: Any combination of string paths or DocumentReference instances.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: collectionGroup
methods.description:
Creates a new Query which includes all documents that are contained in a collection or subcollection with the given collection ID.

A collection group query with a collection ID of foo will return documents from /foo and /abc/dce/foo, but not /foo/abc/dce.

params.name: id
params.description: Identifies the collection to query over. Every collection or subcollection with this ID as the last segment of its path will be included. May not contain a slash.

exceptions.description: If the collection ID is not well-formed.

methods.name: runTransaction
methods.description:
Executes a function in a Firestore transaction.

Transactions offer atomic operations, guaranteeing that either all writes will be applied, or none will be applied. The Google Cloud PHP Firestore client also handles automatic retry in cases where transactions fail due to a retryable error.

Transactions will be committed once the provided callable has finished execution. Thrown exceptions will prevent commit and trigger a rollback, and will bubble up to your level to be handled in whatever fashion is appropriate.

This method returns the return value of the given transaction callable.

params.name: callable
params.description: A callable function, allowing atomic operations against the Firestore API. Function signature should be of form: function (Transaction $t).

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.begin
params.description: Configuration options for BeginTransaction.

params.name: options.commit
params.description: Configuration options for Commit.

params.name: options.rollback
params.description: Configuration options for rollback.

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The maximum number of times to retry failures. Defaults to 5.

params.name: latitude
params.description: The latitude

params.name: longitude
params.description: The longitude

examples.caption: Blobs can be used to store binary data

params.name: value
params.description: The value to store in a blob.

methods.name: fieldPath
methods.description:
Returns a FieldPath class, referring to a field in a document.

The path may consist of a single field name (referring to a top-level field in the document), or a list of field names (referring to a nested field in the document).

params.name: fieldNames
params.description: A list of field names.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.gcLimit
params.description: The number of entities to delete in the garbage collection. Values larger than 500 will be limited to 500. Defaults to 0, indicating garbage collection is disabled by default.

params.name: options.collectionNameTemplate
params.description: A sprintf compatible template for formatting the collection name where sessions will be stored. The template receives two values, the first being the save path and the latter being the session name.

params.name: options.begin
params.description: Configuration options for beginTransaction.

params.name: options.commit
params.description: Configuration options for commit.

params.name: options.rollback
params.description: Configuration options for rollback.

params.name: options.read
params.description: Configuration options for read.

params.name: options.query
params.description: Configuration options for runQuery.
